edu.holycross.shot.prestochango
[Groovy] Class CollectionArchive

java.lang.Object
  edu.holycross.shot.prestochango.CollectionArchive

class CollectionArchive

A CollectionArchive consists of an inventory and a data repository.

Property Summary

java.lang.Integer SCREAM

java.lang.Integer WARN

Root directory of file system containing archival files.

Default character encoding, can be reset dynamically.
groovy cite

Groovy XML namespace for CITE.
java.util.LinkedHashMap citeConfig

Hash map with key information from the inventory file for easy access without having to navigate complex XML.
groovy dc

Groovy XML namespace for Dublin Core.
java.lang.Integer debug

java.util.LinkedHashMap extensionsMap

Hash map with rdf verbs for each supported extension.

CITE Collection inventory serialized in XML to a File.
java.lang.String prefix

RDF namespace declarations.

Method Detail

addOloCsvData

java.lang.String addOloCsvData(java.io.File f, CiteUrn collUrn)
Formats sequencing statments in the OLO ontologry for an ordered collection represented by a tsv file.
returns:
String of RDF statements in the OLO ontology.
Parameters:
f - File with data in tsv format. First row should be property names, subsequent rows should contain data.
collUrn - Cite URN of the collection.

addOloTsvData

java.lang.String addOloTsvData(java.io.File f, CiteUrn collUrn)
Formats sequencing statments in the OLO ontologry for an ordered collection represented by a tsv file.
returns:
String of RDF statements in the OLO ontology.
Parameters:
f - File with data in tsv format. First row should be property names, subsequent rows should contain data.
collUrn - Cite URN of the collection.

configureFromFile

java.util.LinkedHashMap configureFromFile()
Creates a map of the configuration data in this collection's XML capabilities file.
returns:
A map of configuration data or null if the inventory file could not be parsed.

configureFromFile

java.util.LinkedHashMap configureFromFile(java.io.File f)
Creates a map of the configuration data in an XML capabilities file.
returns:
A map of configuration data.
throws:
Exception if the file could not be parsed.
Parameters:
f - The XML capabilities file.

getRdfVerb

java.lang.String getRdfVerb(CiteUrn urn, java.lang.String propertyName)
Finds the value of the rdfVerb for a given property.
returns:
The rdfVerb string, or null if none configured.
throws:
Exception if urn is not a configured collection or if propertyName does not exist in that collection.
Parameters:
urn - The Collection in question.
propertyName - Name of the property.

getSourcePair

java.util.ArrayList getSourcePair(CiteUrn urn)
Finds a single pairing of source type and source name for a Collection. Currently, only 'file' source type is implemented, and source name should be a local file name.
returns:
An ArrayList containing the two items.
Parameters:
urn - The Collection in question.

getTitle

java.lang.String getTitle(CiteUrn urn)
Finds name of property with long description of the Collection.
returns:
Name of the property.
throws:
Exception if urn is not a configured collection.
Parameters:
urn - The Collection in question.

getValueList

java.util.ArrayList getValueList(CiteUrn urn, java.lang.String propertyName)
Finds the list of enumerated values allowed for a property.
returns:
Parameters:
urn - A CiteUrn identifying the collection.
propertyName - Name of the property in question.

isGrouped

boolean isGrouped(CiteUrn urn)

isOrdered

boolean isOrdered(CiteUrn urn)

ttl

void ttl(java.io.File outFile)
Writes a complete RDF description of a Collection Archive in TTL format, without RDF prefix definitions, to a local file. This can be useful when a system like dse that already has prefix statements wants to generate a larger composite RDF description concatenating RDF from multiple sources.
throws:
Exception if unable to parse data in all files of the Collection Archive.
Parameters:
outFile - A local file where output is written.

ttl

void ttl(java.io.File ttl, boolean includePrefix)
Writes a complete RDF description of a Collection Archive in TTL format to a local file.
throws:
Exception if unable to parse data in all files of the Collection Archive.
Parameters:
ttl - A local file where output is written.
includePrefix - Whether or not to include RDF prefix statements in the output.

ttlBasicCsvData

java.lang.String ttlBasicCsvData(java.io.File f, CiteUrn collUrn, boolean ordered)
Formats data rows from a csv file as TTL. First constructs an index of the property names for this object, then cycles through all data rows, and constructs and an array of values that are then passed off to the generic turtleizeOneRow method.
returns:
String expressing the contents of the row in TTL.
throws:
Exception if f cannot be fully parsed.
Parameters:
collUrn - URN of the collection

ttlBasicTsvData

java.lang.String ttlBasicTsvData(java.io.File f, CiteUrn collUrn, boolean ordered)
Formats data rows from a tsv file as TTL. First constructs an index of the property names for this object, then cycles through all data rows, and constructs and an array of values that are then passed off to the generic turtleizeOneRow method.
returns:
String expressing the contents of the row in TTL.
Parameters:
f - File with data in tsv format. First row should be property names, subsequent rows should contain data.
collUrn - Cite URN of the collection.

turtlizeCsv

java.lang.String turtlizeCsv(java.io.File f, java.lang.String urnVal)
Writes an RDF description, in TTL format, of the data contained in a single file in comma-separated value format.
returns:
A String composed of TTL statements.
throws:
Exception if data in f cannote be parsed.
Parameters:
f - The file of data.
urnVal - The URN, as a String, identifying the collection.

turtlizeInventory

java.lang.String turtlizeInventory()
Writes an RDF description, in TTL format, of the data about a collection expressed by the Collection Inventory.
returns:
A String composed of TTL statements.
throws:
Exception if inventory is misconfigured.

turtlizeOneRow

java.lang.String turtlizeOneRow(java.util.ArrayList cols, java.util.ArrayList headingIndex, java.lang.String canonical, java.lang.String label, boolean ordered)
Writes an RDF description, in TTL format, of a single object.
throws:
Exception if collection not configured
Parameters:
cols - An array of data values.
headingIndex - An array of property names, in the same order as the data values in the cols array.
canonical - Name of the canonical ID property in this collection.
label - Name of the rdf:label property in this collection.

turtlizeTsv

java.lang.String turtlizeTsv(java.io.File f, java.lang.String urnVal)
Writes an RDF description, in TTL format, of the data contained in a single file in tab-separated value format.
returns:
A String composed of TTL statements, or a null String if unable to parse urnVal as a CITE URN.
Parameters:
f - The file of data.
urnVal - The URN, as a String, identifying the collection.

validateInventory

void validateInventory(java.lang.String schemaFileName)
Validates the XML serialization of the collection's schema against the published schema for a CITE TextInventory.
throws:
Exception if the XML does not validate.

validateInventory

void validateInventory(java.io.File schemaFile)
